required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intracerebral Gene Therapy in Children With Sanfilippo Type B Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Protocol AMT110-CD-001: A Phase I/II, Open-label, Study of Intracerebral Administration of Adeno-associated Viral Vector Containing the Human Alpha-N-acetylglucosaminidase cDNA in Children With Sanfilippo Type B Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, phase I/II study of intra-cerebral administration of adenovirus-associated viral vector containing the human NAGLU cDNA to children suffering from Sanfilippo type B syndrome.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is an open-label, phase I/II study of intra-cerebral administration of adenovirus-associated viral vector containing the human NAGLU cDNA to children suffering from Sanfilippo type B syndrome.
Four patients, 18 months up to the 5th birthday, have been included.
The inclusion period will be 8 to 12 months. The duration of follow-up for each patient is 1 year post-surgery. The duration of the first extension phase is 18 months. The duration of the second extension phase is 36 months. Therefore, the maximum time of the follow-up will be 66 months

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Related (Serious) Adverse Events as assessed by continuous evaluation of change from baseline
primary_outcome.description: Multiple measurements will be aggregated to derive the number of participants with Abnormal Laboratory Values and/or Adverse Events that are related to Treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with presence of brain atrophy, white matter lesions and other lesions as assessed by cerebral MRI
secondary_outcome.description: MRIs at Baseline, Month 3, Month 12, Month 30, Month 48 and last visit Month 66. Cerebral MRI will be collected for safety assessment to retrospectively evaluate for efficacy at Baseline, D0, Month 3, Month12, Month 30 and last visit Month 66.

arm_group.description: Each patient will receive 960 µL of vector suspension. The vector suspension will be deposited simultaneously at 16 sites, each deposit containing 2.4x 1011 vg (4x1012 vg in total).

intervention.description: one-time brain intraparenchymal gene therapy dose
